intro: Hieracium diaphanoides subsp. hebecalyx, commonly known as the slender-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat head. It is notable for its slender stem and is often found in moist or calcareous soils.
